CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:CSCO); Cisco Systems designs, manufactures, and sells networking and other products related to the communications and information technology industry and provides services associated with these products and their use. Co.'s products are installed at corporations, public institutions, telecommunications companies, and commercial businesses and are also found in personal residences. Co. provides a line of products for transporting data, voice, and video within buildings, across campuses, and around the world. Co. conducts its business globally and is managed geographically in five segments: the U.S. and Canada; European Markets; Emerging Markets; Asia Pacific; and Japan.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:BAC); Bank of America, with $1.292 trillion in total assets as of Dec 31 2005, is a bank holding and financial holding company. Co.'s Global Consumer and Small Business Banking segment provides a range of products and services to individuals and small businesses. Global Business and Financial Services primarily provides commercial lending and treasury management services to middle-market companies. Global Capital Markets and Investment Banking provides capital-raising services, advisory services, derivatives capabilities, equity and debt sales and trading. Global Wealth and Investment Management offers services to institutional clients, high net-worth individuals and retail customers.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:T); AT&T is a holding company. Through Co.'s subsidiaries and affiliates, Co. provides communications services and products in the U.S. and in 240 countries. Co. offers its services and products to consumers in the U.S. and services and products to businesses and other providers of telecommunications services worldwide. The services and products that Co. offers vary by market, and include: local exchange services, wireless communications, long-distance services, data/broadband and Internet services, telecommunications equipment, managed networking, and wholesale transport services and directory advertising and publishing.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:XOM); Exxon Mobil and its divisions and affiliated companies principal business is energy, involving exploration for, and production of, crude oil and natural gas, manufacture of petroleum products and transportation and sale of crude oil, natural gas and petroleum products. Co. operates or markets products in the United States and about 200 other countries and territories. Co. is a manufacturer and marketer of commodity petrochemicals, including olefins, aromatics, polyethylene and polypropylene plastics and a variety of specialty products. Co. also has interests in electric power generation facilities. Affiliates of Co. conduct extensive research programs in support of these businesses.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:PG); Procter & Gamble is engaged in providing branded consumer goods products, sold through retail operations including mass merchandisers, grocery stores, membership club stores and drug stores. Co. has an organizational structure that comprised of three Global Business Units (GBUs): Beauty and Health; Household Care; and Gillette GBU; as well as a Global Operations group. The Global Operations group consists of the Market Development Organization (MDO) and Global Business Services (GBS). Co. has seven reportable segments: Beauty; Health Care; Fabric Care and Home Care; Pet Health, Snacks and Coffee; Baby Care and Family Care; Blades and Razors; and Duracell and Braun.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:HPQ); Hewlett-Packard is a global provider of products, technologies, systems and services to individual consumers, small and medium sized businesses and large enterprises. Co.'s offerings cover enterprise storage and servers; multi-vendor services including technology support and maintenance; consulting, integration and managed services; personal computing and other access devices; and imaging as well as printing-related products and services. As of Oct 31 2005, Co.'s operations were organized into seven business segments: Enterprise Storage and Servers; HP Services; Software, Personal Systems Group; Imaging and Printing Group; HP Financial Services; and Corporate Investments.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:IBM); International Business Machines is a worldwide information technology company which primarily provides a variety of business products and services through the utilization of information technology. Co.'s primary operations comprise a Global Services segment; a Systems and Technology Group, which provides clients with business services that require advanced computing power and storage capabilities; a Software segment, which consists primarily of middleware and operating systems software; a Global Financing segment; and an Enterprise Investments segment which develops and provides industry-specific IT systems supporting all Co.'s other segment.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:MSFT); Microsoft develops, manufactures, licenses, and supports a wide range of software products for many computing devices. Co.'s software products include operating systems for servers, PCs, and intelligent devices; server applications for distributed computing environments; information worker productivity applications; business solutions applications; and software development tools. Co. provides consulting and product support services, and trains and certifies system integrators and developers. Co. sells the Xbox video game console and games, PC games, and PC peripherals. Online communication and information services are delivered through Co.'s MSN portals and channels around the world.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:BA); Boeing is an aerospace firm. Co. operates in six principal segments: Commercial Airplanes; Aircraft and Weapon Systems (A&WS), Network Systems, Support Systems and Launch and Orbital Systems (L&OS), collectively Integrated Defense Systems (IDS); and Boeing Capital Corp. (BCC). Co.'s Other segment classification principally includes the activities of Connexion by Boeingsm, a two-way data communications service for global travelers; and Boeing Technology, an advanced research and development organization focused on innovative technologies, improved processes and the creation of new products.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:MHP); The McGraw-Hill is a global information services provider serving the financial services, education and business information markets with information products and services. Co.'s other markets also include energy, construction, aerospace and defense, and marketing information services. Co. operates through three business segments: Education; Financial Services; and Information & Media. In addition, Co. serves its customers through a range of distribution channels including printed books, magazines and newsletters; online via Internet Web sites and digital platforms; through wireless and traditional on-air broadcasting; and through a variety of conferences and trade shows.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:GE); General Electric is engaged in developing, manufacturing, marketing and providing related services for a variety of products for the generation, transmission, distribution, control and utilization of electricity. Through its affiliate, NBC Universal Inc., Co. also produces and delivers network television services, produces and distributes motion pictures, and operates television stations, cable/satellite networks, theme parks, and program activities in multimedia and the Internet. Through another affiliate, General Electric Capital Services Inc., Co. offers an array of financial and other related services.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:TWX); Time Warner is a media and entertainment company. Co. classifies its business into five reporting segments: America Online (AOL), consisting of interactive services; Cable, consisting of interests in cable systems providing video, high-speed data and digital phone services; Filmed Entertainment, consisting of feature film, television and home video production and distribution; Networks, consisting of cable television and broadcast networks; and Publishing, consisting of magazine and book publishing. Co.'s AOL segment and its subsidiaries operate a network of web brands and an internet access subscription service in the U.S.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-pr newswire] S&P 500 3rd Quarter Buybacks Reach Record $172 Billion
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:GS); Goldman Sachs Group is a global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a range of services worldwide to a variety of client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Co.'s activities are divided into three segments: Investment Banking which is composed of Financial Advisory and Underwriting; Trading & Principal Investments which consists of Fixed Income, Currency and Commodities, Equities, and Principal Investments; and Asset Management & Securities Services. As of Nov 25 2005, Co. operated offices in over 20 countries and approximately 38% of its 22,425 employees were based outside the U.S.

Co.'s component-level products consist of integrated circuits used to process information. Co.'s operating segments are: the Digital Enterprise Group, the Mobility Group, the Flash Memory Group, the Digital Home Group, the Digital Health Group, and the Channel Platforms Group.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:TMS); Thomson is a holding company serving the media and entertainment industries. Through its subsidiaries, Co. is engaged in three segments. Through the Digital Content Solutions segment, Co. develops technologies, systems and services for content preparation and distribution. In addition, Co. offers professional broadcast equipment and interactive video network equipment. The Consumer Products segment produces and sells television, video, audio, communication devices, DVD players, decoders and consumer electronic equipment. The Industry and Consumer Products segment produces and sells professional equipment and manages the licenses and patents of Co.'s multimedia group.

The Institutional Securities business includes securities underwriting and distribution, financial advisory services, sales, trading, financing and market-making activities in equity and fixed income securities, principal investing and aircraft financing activities. CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:S); Sprint Nextel is a communications company offering a suite of wireless and wireline communications products and services. Co.'s operations are divided into three lines of business: wireless, long distance and local. Co., together with third-party affiliates, and Nextel Partners, Inc., offer digital wireless service in all 50 states, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, and served more than 49.6 million wireless subscribers at Dec 31 2005. Through the Long Distance segment, Co. provides wireline voice and data communications services to residential customers and corporations. Co.'s Local segment provides regulated incumbent local phone services in local service territories.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-businesswire] SDC Solutions Releases New Version of IntelliSPEECH(R) Intelligent Virtual Agent
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:AV); Avaya is a provider of communications systems, applications and services for enterprises, including businesses, government agencies and other organizations. Co.'s product offerings include Internet Protocol (IP) telephony systems and traditional voice communications systems; multi-media contact center infrastructure and applications in support of customer relationship management; and unified communications applications and appliances, such as IP telephone sets. Co. has two operating segments: Global Communications Solutions and Avaya Global Services.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-businesswire] SDC Solutions Releases New Version of IntelliSPEECH(R) Intelligent Virtual Agent
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:SI); Siemens provides solutions in electrical engineering and electronics. Specifically, Co. manufactures information and communications systems for networking and mobile telecommunications and provides information and communication services. In addition, Co. produces automation systems and drives, logistics and factory automation equipment, monitoring and regulating equipment, power generation and power transmission and distribution equipment and products and services for the rail industry. Co. also produces automotive electronics, medical diagnostic and therapeutic systems and devices, lighting products and semiconductor circuits and systems.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-businesswire] SDC Solutions Releases New Version of IntelliSPEECH(R) Intelligent Virtual Agent
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:NUAN); Nuance Communications is a provider of speech and imaging devices for businesses and consumers worldwide. Co. delivers its technologies and services in two markets: speech and imaging. Co.'s speech technologies enable voice-activated services over a telephone, transform speech into written word and permit the control of devices and applications by simply speaking. Co.'s imaging technologies eliminate the need to manually reproduce documents, automate the integration of documents into business systems, and enable the use of electronic documents and forms within database, Internet, mobile and other business applications.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-businesswire] SDC Solutions Releases New Version of IntelliSPEECH(R) Intelligent Virtual Agent
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:NT); Nortel Networks is a Canadian based company engaged in delivering communications capabilities to its customers. Co. offers converged multimedia networks that use packet, wireless, voice and optical technologies. Co.'s products are used by both service providers and enterprises. Co.'s networking solutions consist of hardware, software and services. Co.'s business consists of the design, development, manufacture, assembly, marketing, sale, licensing, installation, servicing and support of these networking solutions. A substantial portion of Co.'s business has a technology focus and is dedicated to making strategic investments in research and development.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:NVAX); Novavax is a biopharmaceutical company that is engaged in creating differentiated pharmaceutical as well as vaccine products and licensing them at various stages of development to several licensing partners. Co.'s drug delivery technologies include its Micellar Nanoparticle (MNP) technology, which is the basis for the development of its first FDA approved product, ESTRASORB®; Novasomes® (paucillamellar non-phospholipid liposomes); and Sterisomes®. Co.'s vaccine technologies include functional virus-like particle (VLP) manufacturing utilizing the baculovirus expression system in insect cells as well as vaccine adjuvants based on Novasomes® and dendrimer technologies.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:SIRI); Sirius Satellite Radio is a provider of satellite radio service. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. provides over 133 channels, including 69 channels of commercial-free music and over 64 channels of sports, news, talk, entertainment, traffic and weather programming to subscribers throughout the continental U.S. Co.'s commercial-free music channels are produced principally at its national broadcast studio in New York City and covers virtually every genre of music. Co.'s non-music streams include programming from CNN, FOX News, ESPN, NPR, The Weather Channel, traffic for America's top 20 markets and a number of other talk and entertainment channels. At Dec 31 2005, Co. had 3.3 million subscribers.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:CSCO); Cisco Systems designs, manufactures, and sells networking and other products related to the communications and information technology industry and provides services associated with these products and their use. Co.'s products are installed at corporations, public institutions, telecommunications companies, and commercial businesses and are also found in personal residences. Co. provides a line of products for transporting data, voice, and video within buildings, across campuses, and around the world. Co. conducts its business globally and is managed geographically in five segments: the U.S. and Canada; European Markets; Emerging Markets; Asia Pacific; and Japan.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:F); Ford Motor is a global automaker. Co.'s automotive sector is engaged in the design, manufacture, sale and service of cars, trucks, vehicle components and systems. The sector also provides after-the-sale vehicle services and products, including maintenance and light repair, heavy repair, collision, vehicle accessories and extended repair service products. Co.'s financial services sector primarily includes Ford Motor Credit, which primarily includes vehicle-related financing, leasing and insurance. Co. also has an equity interest in Mazda Motor Corp. of about 33.4%. As of Dec 31 2005, Co.'s automotive brands included Aston Martin, Ford, Jaguar, Land Rover, Lincoln, Mercury and Volvo.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-m2 - 10 meters] Research and Markets Adds Report: 2008 Trends to Watch: Unified Communications
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:RTEC); Rudolph Technologies is engaged in the design, development and manufacture of process control metrology and defect inspection systems used by semiconductor device manufacturers. Co. provides full-fab applications through a family of stand-alone systems and integrated modules for both transparent and opaque thin film measurements, and macro-defect detection. These systems, which have production-worthy automation, are designed specifically for semiconductor manufacturing applications and are backed by worldwide customer support. Co. markets and sells products to all major logic, memory, and application-specific integrated circuit device manufacturers.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-m2 - 10 meters] Research and Markets Adds Report: 2008 Trends to Watch: Unified Communications
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:MSFT); Microsoft develops, manufactures, licenses, and supports a wide range of software products for many computing devices. Co.'s software products include operating systems for servers, PCs, and intelligent devices; server applications for distributed computing environments; information worker productivity applications; business solutions applications; and software development tools. Co. provides consulting and product support services, and trains and certifies system integrators and developers. Co. sells the Xbox video game console and games, PC games, and PC peripherals. Online communication and information services are delivered through Co.'s MSN portals and channels around the world.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-m2 - 10 meters] Research and Markets Adds Report: 2008 Trends to Watch: Unified Communications
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:WEBX); WebEx Communications provides services allowing end-users to conduct meetings and share software applications, documents, presentations and other content online to participate over the Internet using a standard web browser. Integrated telephony and web-based audio and video services are also available using standard devices such as telephones, computer web-cameras and microphones. Co. offers audio conferencing service called WebEx Audio, a service for monitoring usage of WebEx services within an organization called WebEx GlobalWatch, and an asynchronous add-on called WebEx Workspace, which shares certain of the asynchronous features of the standalone WebEx WebOffice offering.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-m2 - 10 meters] Research and Markets Adds Report: 2008 Trends to Watch: Unified Communications
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:FMC); FMC is a chemical company serving agricultural, industrial and consumer markets globally. Co. operates its operations through three segments; Agricultural Products, which focuses on insecticides that are used to enhance crop yield and quality by controlling a spectrum of pests, and on herbicides, which are used to reduce the need for manual or mechanical weeding; Specialty Chemicals which consists of Co.'s BioPolymer and lithium businesses and focus on food ingredients; and Industrial Chemicals that manufactures inorganic materials, including soda ash, hydrogen peroxide, specialty peroxygens and phosphorus chemicals.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:NVAX); Novavax is a biopharmaceutical company that is engaged in creating differentiated pharmaceutical as well as vaccine products and licensing them at various stages of development to several licensing partners. Co.'s drug delivery technologies include its Micellar Nanoparticle (MNP) technology, which is the basis for the development of its first FDA approved product, ESTRASORB®; Novasomes® (paucillamellar non-phospholipid liposomes); and Sterisomes®. Co.'s vaccine technologies include functional virus-like particle (VLP) manufacturing utilizing the baculovirus expression system in insect cells as well as vaccine adjuvants based on Novasomes® and dendrimer technologies.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:SIRI); Sirius Satellite Radio is a provider of satellite radio service. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. provides over 133 channels, including 69 channels of commercial-free music and over 64 channels of sports, news, talk, entertainment, traffic and weather programming to subscribers throughout the continental U.S. Co.'s commercial-free music channels are produced principally at its national broadcast studio in New York City and covers virtually every genre of music. Co.'s non-music streams include programming from CNN, FOX News, ESPN, NPR, The Weather Channel, traffic for America's top 20 markets and a number of other talk and entertainment channels. At Dec 31 2005, Co. had 3.3 million subscribers.

Through another affiliate, General Electric Capital Services Inc., Co. offers an array of financial and other related services.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:R); Ryder System is engaged in the transportation and supply chain management. Co.'s business is divided into three business segments. Fleet Management Solutions provides leasing, commercial rental and programmed maintenance of commercial trucks, tractors and trailers to customers in the U.S., Canada and the U.K. Supply Chain Solutions provides supply chain consulting and lead logistics management services throughout North America and in Latin America, Europe and Asia. Dedicated Contract Carriage provides vehicles and drivers as part of a dedicated transportation service in North America. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. and its subsidiaries held a fleet of 137,000 trucks, tractors and trailers.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:BPL); Buckeye Partners is primarily engaged in the transportation, terminalling and storage of refined petroleum products for key integrated oil companies, large refined products marketing companies and key end-users of petroleum products on a fee basis through facilities owned and operated by Co. Co. also operates pipelines owned by third parties under contracts with key integrated oil and chemical companies and performs pipeline construction activities. As of Dec 31 2005, Co.'s facilities included approximately 5,000 miles of 6-inch to 24-inch diameter pipeline, 100 delivery points and 43 active bulk storage and terminal facilities with aggregate capacity of approximately 16.6 million barrels.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:CVX); Chevron is a global energy company engaged in fully integrated petroleum operations, chemicals operations and coal mining activities. Co. also holds investments in power generation and gasification businesses. Petroleum operations consist of exploring for, developing and producing crude oil and natural gas; refining crude oil into finished petroleum products; marketing crude oil, natural gas and the many products derived from petroleum; and transporting crude oil, natural gas and petroleum products. As of Dec 31 2005, net proved reserves of natural gas were 20.466 trillion cubic feet and net proved reserves of crude oil, condensate and natural gas liquids totaled 5.63 billion barrels.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:AMZN); Amazon.com operates retail websites. Co. has two main segments: North America, which includes www.amazon.com and www.amazon.ca; and International, which includes www.amazon.co.uk, www.amazon.de, www.amazon.fr, www.amazon.co.jp and www.joyo.com. In addition, Co. operates other websites, including www.a9.com and www.alexa.com that enable search and navigation; www.imdb.com, a movie database, and Amazon Mechanical Turk at www.mturk.com, which provides a Web service for computers to integrate a network of humans directly into their processes. Co.'s websites enable it to sell various products across dozens of product categories, such as books, music and musical instrument, software, and beauty.

Co. conducts its operations through five core operating segments: Exploration and Production, Oil Products, Downstream Gas and Power, Chemicals and Renewables. Co. also produces and sells petrochemical building blocks to industrial customers globally.

Through its subsidiaries, Co. is engaged in the exploration and production of crude oil and natural gas; refining, marketing, supply and transportation; and the manufacture and marketing of petrochemicals. Co. operates globally, with business activities in more than 100 countries in Europe, the US, Canada, Russia, South America, Australasia, Asia and Africa. Co. also maintains exploration and production interests in 26 countries. Co. operates in three business segments: Exploration & Production; Refining & Marketing; and Gas, Power & Renewables.

Co. provides a line of products for transporting data, voice, and video within buildings, across campuses, and around the world. Primary products include diesel oil, naphtha, fuel oils, liquefied petroleum gas (LGP) and alcohol in hydrated and anhydrated forms. Co. is also engaged in the production and sale of natural gas. Through its subsidiaries, Co. is engaged in the sale and distribution of oil, gasoline, alcohol and lubricants, and in the production and sale of petrochemical products and fertilizers. Overseas, Co. is engaged in the exploration and production of petroleum through its subsidiary Petrobras Internacional S.A.-Braspetro.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-dowjones select] DJ ADR REPORT: Overseas Shares Follow Wall Street Down
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:CEO); Cnooc is an investment holding company. Through its subsidiaries, Co. is engaged in the exploration, development, production and sale of crude oil, natural gas and other petroleum products in the People's Republic of China, Indonesia and Australia. Co. is also engaged in bond issuance. As of Dec 31 2005, net proved reserves were 1,457.4 million barrels for crude and liquids and 5,430.9 billion cubic feet for natural gas.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-dowjones select] DJ ADR REPORT: Overseas Shares Follow Wall Street Down
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:VIV); Vivo Participacoes is one of the 12 holding companies of the Brazilian telecommunications market. Through its subsidiaries Telesp Celular, Global Telecom and Tele Centro Oeste Celular Participacoes, Co. is a supplier of cellular communication is the states of Sao Paulo, Parana, Santa Catarina and Distrito Federal, following the terms of a concession granted by the Brazilian Federal Government, which expires on Aug 5 2008, Apr 8 2013 and July 24 2006, respectively, and can be renewed. Co. operates on Band A and Band B, following the regulations set by the National Telecommunications Agency (Anatel). As of Dec 31 2005, Co. had 201 cellular phone stores and 5,538 points of service.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-dowjones select] DJ ADR REPORT: Overseas Shares Follow Wall Street Down
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:BIDU); Baidu.com offers Internet search solutions and online marketing solutions, develops and markets scaleable web application software and provides related services. Co.'s principal geographic market is in the People's Republic of China. Co. does not conduct any substantive operations of its own and conducts its primary business operations through Baidu Online and Baidu Netcom.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-dowjones select] DJ ADR REPORT: Overseas Shares Follow Wall Street Down
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:DJ); Dow Jones & Co. is a provider of global business and financial news, information and insight through newspapers, newswires, magazines, the Internet, indexes, television and radio. In addition to The Wall Street Journal and its international and online editions, Co. publishes the print and online editions of Barron's, Dow Jones Newswires, Dow Jones Indexes and MarketWatch.com. Co. also provides news and information of general interest to local communities throughout the U.S. via its Ottaway group of community newspapers. Co. is co-owner with Reuters Group of Factiva and with Hearst of SmartMoney. Co. also provides news content to CNBC television operations and radio stations in the U.S.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-dowjones select] DJ ADR REPORT: Overseas Shares Follow Wall Street Down
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:RIO); Companhia Vale do Rio Doce is primarily engaged in the mining, rail transportation, pelletizing, sale and export of iron ore, manganese and gold. Co. is also engaged in the operation of port terminals located throughout Brazil. Through subsidiaries and associated companies, Co. is engaged in the following activities: the extraction, pelletizing and sale of iron ore; the management of forestry resources and the production and sale of pulp and paper; the extraction, production and sale of aluminum and bauxite; the production, sale and export of steel and ferroalloys in Brazil, the U.S., France and Argentina; deep sea and coastal freight transportation.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-dowjones select] DJ ADR REPORT: Overseas Shares Follow Wall Street Down
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:SI); Siemens provides solutions in electrical engineering and electronics. Specifically, Co. manufactures information and communications systems for networking and mobile telecommunications and provides information and communication services. In addition, Co. produces automation systems and drives, logistics and factory automation equipment, monitoring and regulating equipment, power generation and power transmission and distribution equipment and products and services for the rail industry. Co. also produces automotive electronics, medical diagnostic and therapeutic systems and devices, lighting products and semiconductor circuits and systems.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-dowjones select] DJ ADR REPORT: Overseas Shares Follow Wall Street Down
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:BP); BP is a holding company. Through its subsidiaries, Co. is engaged in the exploration and production of crude oil and natural gas; refining, marketing, supply and transportation; and the manufacture and marketing of petrochemicals. Co. operates globally, with business activities in more than 100 countries in Europe, the US, Canada, Russia, South America, Australasia, Asia and Africa. Co. also maintains exploration and production interests in 26 countries. Co. operates in three business segments: Exploration & Production; Refining & Marketing; and Gas, Power & Renewables.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:CSCO); Cisco Systems designs, manufactures, and sells networking and other products related to the communications and information technology industry and provides services associated with these products and their use. Co.'s products are installed at corporations, public institutions, telecommunications companies, and commercial businesses and are also found in personal residences. Co. provides a line of products for transporting data, voice, and video within buildings, across campuses, and around the world. Co. conducts its business globally and is managed geographically in five segments: the U.S. and Canada; European Markets; Emerging Markets; Asia Pacific; and Japan.

Co.'s primary operations comprise a Global Services segment; a Systems and Technology Group, which provides clients with business services that require advanced computing power and storage capabilities; a Software segment, which consists primarily of middleware and operating systems software; a Global Financing segment; and an Enterprise Investments segment which develops and provides industry-specific IT systems supporting all Co.'s other segment.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:MFE); McAfee is engaged as a provider of computer security solutions designed to prevent intrusions on networks and computer systems. Co. offers two families of products, McAfee System Protection Solutions and McAfee Network Protection Solutions. McAfee System Protection Solutions delivers anti-virus and security products and services designed to protect systems such as desktops and servers. McAfee Network Protection Solutions offers products designed to maximize the performance and security of networks and network intrusion prevention with McAfee IntruShield and McAfee Foundstone.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:IHP); IHOP and its subsidiaries develops, franchises and operates International House of Pancakes (IHOP), restaurants, a national, family restaurant chains. At Dec 31 2005, there were 1,242 IHOP restaurants. Franchisees operated 1,082 of these restaurants, area licensees operated 153 restaurants, and Co. operated seven restaurants. Co.'s restaurants are located in 48 states and Canada. Co.'s restaurants features table service and moderately priced, high-quality food and beverage items in an attractive and comfortable atmosphere and are open throughout the day and evening hours, and many operates 24 hours a day.

Co.'s products are installed at corporations, public institutions, telecommunications companies, and commercial businesses and are also found in personal residences. Co. provides a line of products for transporting data, voice, and video within buildings, across campuses, and around the world. Co. conducts its business globally and is managed geographically in five segments: the U.S. and Canada; European Markets; Emerging Markets; Asia Pacific; and Japan.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:NBL); Noble Energy is engaged in the exploration, development, production and marketing of crude oil and natural gas. Co.'s domestic areas consist of: offshore in the Gulf of Mexico and California; the Gulf Coast Region (Louisiana and Texas); the Mid-continent Region (Oklahoma and Kansas); and the Rocky Mountain Region (Colorado, Montana, Nevada, Wyoming and California). Co.'s international areas of operations include Argentina, China, Ecuador, Equatorial Guinea, the Mediterranean Sea (Israel) and the North Sea (the Netherlands and the U.K.). As of Dec 31 2005, Co.'s total proved reserves were 3.09 trillion cubic feet of natural gas and 291.0 million barrels of crude oil.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:C); Citigroup is a bank holding company. Through its subsidiaries, Co. is engaged in providing a broad range of financial services to consumer and corporate customers. Co.'s activities are conducted through the Global Consumer Group (U.S. and International)- credit cards, consumer lending, retail distribution, commercial business, consumer finance and retail banking; Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) - capital markets and transaction services; Global Wealth Management - Smith Barney, Citigroup Investment Research and Private Bank; Alternative Investments; and Corporate/Other business segments. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. had assets of $1.49 billion and total deposits of $593.00 billion.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:F); Ford Motor is a global automaker. Co.'s automotive sector is engaged in the design, manufacture, sale and service of cars, trucks, vehicle components and systems. The sector also provides after-the-sale vehicle services and products, including maintenance and light repair, heavy repair, collision, vehicle accessories and extended repair service products. Co.'s financial services sector primarily includes Ford Motor Credit, which primarily includes vehicle-related financing, leasing and insurance. Co. also has an equity interest in Mazda Motor Corp. of about 33.4%. As of Dec 31 2005, Co.'s automotive brands included Aston Martin, Ford, Jaguar, Land Rover, Lincoln, Mercury and Volvo.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:T); AT&T is a holding company. Through Co.'s subsidiaries and affiliates, Co. provides communications services and products in the U.S. and in 240 countries. Co. offers its services and products to consumers in the U.S. and services and products to businesses and other providers of telecommunications services worldwide. The services and products that Co. offers vary by market, and include: local exchange services, wireless communications, long-distance services, data/broadband and Internet services, telecommunications equipment, managed networking, and wholesale transport services and directory advertising and publishing.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:CS); Credit Suisse Group is global financial services company. The Credit Suisse Financial Services business unit provides comprehensive financial services in Europe and other selected markets. Credit Suisse Financial Services consists of four segments: Private Banking, Corporate and Retail Banking, Life and Pensions, and Non-Life. The Credit Suisse First Boston business unit serves institutional, corporate, government and high-net-worth clients around the world, with a broad range of financial products and investment advisory services. Credit Suisse First Boston consists of two segments: Institutional Securities and Wealth and Asset Management.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:LBTYA); Liberty Global is an international broadband communications provider of video, voice and Internet access services. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. provided its services to 13 European countries through its indirect wholly-owned subsidiary UGC Europe Inc. (UGC Europe) and its wholly-owned subsidiaries UPC Holding B.V. (UPC Holding) and Liberty Global Switzerland Inc. (LG Switzerland). In addition, Co. also operated in Japan through its indirect controlling ownership interest in Jupiter Telecommunications Co. Ltd. (J:COM); as well as in Chile through its indirect 80%-owned subsidiary VTR GlobalCom, S.A. (VTR).

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:LSE); Capital Lease Funding is a real estate investment trust that owns and finances primarily single tenant commercial real estate assets subject to long-term leases to primarily investment grade tenants. Co. invests at all levels of the capital structure of net lease properties, including equity investments in real estate (owned real properties), debt investments (mortgage loans and net lease mortgage backed securities) and mezzanine investments secured by net leased real estate collateral. Tenants underlying Co.'s net lease investments are primarily public companies or their operating subsidiaries and governmental and quasi-governmental entities with investment grade credit ratings.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:FLS); Flowserve is a manufacturer and aftermarket service provider of comprehensive flow control systems. Co. develops and manufactures precision-engineered flow control equipment for critical service applications. The flow control system components include pumps, valves and mechanical seals. Co.'s products and services are used in several industries, including petroleum, chemical, power generation and water treatment. At Dec 31 2005, Co. operated in three business segments: the Pump Division which supplied engineered and industrial pumps; the Flow Control Division which supplied valves and related products; and the Flow Solutions Division which provided mechanical seals and related services.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:TSRA); Tessera Technologies is a provider of miniaturization technologies for the electronics industry. Co. licenses a substantial portion of its intellectual property under its Tessera Compliant Chip (TCC) license. This license primarily covers Co.'s core chip-scale and multi-chip packaging patents. Additionally, Co. offers an intellectual property license under its wafer level technologies license, which covers its wafer level optical packaging patents. In addition, Co. supports the adoption of its technology by providing its customers with engineering services focused on addressing key issues related to the miniaturization and performance of electronics products.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:THC); Tenet Healthcare is a health care provider, primarily through the operation of general hospitals. As of Dec 31 2005, Co.'s subsidiaries operated 73 general hospitals with 18,259 licensed beds, serving urban and rural communities in 13 states. Of those hospitals, 59 were owned by Co.'s subsidiaries and 14 were owned by third parties and leased by its subsidiaries. As of Dec 31 2005, Co.'s subsidiaries also owned or leased various related health care facilities, including two rehabilitation hospitals, an acute care hospital, a cancer hospital, four skilled nursing facilities and 72 medical office buildings, each of which is located on the same campus or nearby one of Co.'s general hospitals.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:CGPI); CollaGenex Pharmaceuticals is a specialty pharmaceutical company focused on developing and marketing proprietary medical therapies to the dermatology market. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. marketed three prescription pharmaceutical products to the dermatology market through its dermatology sales force and generated revenue from prescription pharmaceutical products that it continues to sell to the dental market. Co.'s marketed dermatology products are: Pandel®, a prescription corticosteroid cream it licensed from Altana, Inc.; Alcortin?, a prescription topical antifungal steroid combination; and Novacort?, a prescription topical steroid and anesthetic.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:BYD); Boyd Gaming is a multi-jurisdictional gaming company that owns and operates 18 wholly-owned casino entertainment facilities located in five states. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. owned an aggregate of approximately 969,500 square feet of casino space, containing 26,751 slot machines and 626 table games. Co.'s properties include 12 casinos in Nevada, including Stardust Resort and Casino on the Las Vegas Strip, three in Louisiana, and one each in Mississippi, Illinois and Indiana. Co. also owns a 50.0% interest in the Borgata Hotel Casino and Spa in Atlantic City, NJ.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:LTD); Limited Brands sells women's intimate apparel, personal care and beauty products, and women's and men's apparel under various trade names through its retail stores and direct response channels (catalogue and e-commerce). Co.'s Victoria's Secret segment sells women's intimate and other apparel, beauty products and accessories under the Victoria's Secret brand. Co.'s Bath & Body Works segment sells personal care, beauty and home fragrance products marketed under the Bath & Body Works, C.O. Bigelow and White Barn Candle Company brands. Co.'s Apparel segment sells women's and men's apparel through Express and Limited Stores. As of Jan 28 2006, Co. operated a total of 3,590 retail stores.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:USU); USEC is a global energy company that supplies of low-enriched uranium (LEU) for commercial nuclear power plants. Co., either directly or through its subsidiaries, U.S. Enrichment Corporation and NAC International Inc. (NAC) supplies LEU to both domestic and international utilities for use in about 150 nuclear reactors worldwide; are the executive agent for the U.S. Government for a nuclear non-proliferation program with Russia; performs contract work for the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) and DOE contractors at the Paducah and Portsmouth plants, and provides transportation and storage systems for spent nuclear fuel and provides nuclear and energy consulting services.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION1: [comtex-investrend] FirstAlert: 12 P.M. Investrend / Bestcalls
CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NASDAQ:RFMD); RF Micro Devices designs and manufactures high-performance radio frequency (RF) components and systems for mobile communications. Co.'s power amplifiers (PAs), transmit modules, cellular transceivers and transceiver modules and system-on-chip (SoC) systems enable worldwide mobility, provide connectivity and support advanced functionality in mobile devices, cellular base stations, wireless local area networks (WLANs), wireless personal area networks (WPANs) and global positioning systems (GPS). Co. provides standard and custom-designed RF components and system-level programs.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:TGT); Target operates large-format general merchandise discount stores, which include Target and SuperTarget stores. Co. also maintains a credit card operation and operates Target.com, an online business. Target offers a wide assortment of general merchandise and a more limited assortment of food items in its stores. SuperTarget stores offer a full line of food items along with general merchandise. As of Dec 31 2005, Co. owned 1,166 stores, leased 77 stores, and operated 154 ?combined? stores for a total of 1,397 locations. Stores within the ?combined? category are primarily owned buildings on leased land.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:WM); Washington Mutual is a thrift holding company providing financial services to consumers and small businesses. Co. accepts deposits from the public, originates, purchases, services and sells home loans, makes consumer, home equity and commercial real estate loans, and, to a lesser extent, engages in certain commercial banking activities. Co. originates, purchases from correspondents, sells and services loans to subprime borrowers through its specialty mortgage finance operations. Co. also markets annuities and other insurance products, provides securities brokerage services and acts as the investment advisor to, and the distributor of, mutual funds.

CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION2: (NYSE:WMT); Wal-Mart Stores operated 1,224 discount department stores, 1,929 Supercenters, 558 Sam's Clubs and 97 Neighborhood Markets in the U.S. as of Jan 31 2006. Co. also operated in Argentina, Brazil, Canada, China, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Germany, Guatemala, Honduras, Japan, Mexico, Nicaragua, Puerto Rico, South Korea, and the U.K. Co.'s supercenters combine food, general merchandise, and services including pharmacy, dry cleaning, portrait studios, photo finishing, hair salons, medical clinics and optical shops. In addition, Co. owned a majority share in Seiyu, Ltd., which operates over 400 stores throughout Japan.
